content:
It's great that you have some existing connections with local directors and producers! Mentioning your recent experience in the musical theater workshop at the community center can be a good idea, but do it tactfully. Here's why:

**Why mention your experience:**

1. **Relevance**: If the workshop was related to musical theater, it's relevant to mention it when inquiring about auditions or productions in the same genre.
2. **Demonstrate your commitment**: By mentioning your recent experience, you're showing that you're actively involved in the local theater scene and committed to improving your skills.
3. **Common ground**: If the director or producer is familiar with the community center or the workshop, it can be a great conversation starter and help establish a connection.

**How to mention your experience:**

1. **Keep it brief**: Don't go into too much detail about the workshop. A simple mention of your participation and what you learned or gained from the experience is sufficient.
2. **Focus on the benefits**: Instead of just listing your experience, explain how it has prepared you for future productions or how it has helped you grow as a performer.
3. **Show enthusiasm and humility**: Express your excitement about the opportunity to work with the director or producer and acknowledge that you're still learning and growing as an artist.

**Example email or message:**

"Hi [Director's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to reach out and express my interest in working with you on an upcoming production. I recently participated in a musical theater workshop at the community center, where I had the opportunity to hone my skills and learn from some amazing instructors. I'm excited to apply what I learned to a new project and would love to know if you have any auditions or productions coming up that might be a good fit for me.

If you have any information to share, I'd greatly appreciate it. I'm looking forward to hearing from you and potentially working together soon.

Best regards,
[Your Name]"

Remember to keep your message concise, professional, and focused on your enthusiasm for working with the director or producer. By mentioning your recent experience, you're showing that you're proactive and dedicated to your craft, which can only help your case. Good luck!
